messages.title: Vote for SNP Candidate, Alison Lindsay, at the Westminster Election.
messages.content: Your choice at the next Westminster Election is between the Scottish National Party, which will always fight for the interests of the people of Stirling and the existing Westminster parties who have failed this constituency before.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Freezing Council tax on health, education and housekeeping spending
Supports the Stirling Council in providing new Council housing on NHS Forth Valley land, the Labour Party turf them out.
Freezing Council tax on health, education and housekeeping spending
Supports Council tax freeze despite budgetary cutbacks from central government.

mentions.partyLeader: Bruce Crawford MSP and Adam Ingram, Executive Minister of Children and Early Years
mentions.tacticalSituation: The only party to beat both Labour and Tories!

issues.economy: SNP ideas are dynamic and progressive, compared to Labour's ruinous running of the economy.
issues.environment: The SNP Government leads the way on climate change.
issues.governance: Supports freezing Council tax despite cutbacks from central government.

housing.content: Supports the Stirling Council in providing new Council housing on NHS Forth Valley land, the Labour Party turf them out.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have had the satisfaction of contributing positively to the success of our schools within the capacity of educator in Clackmannanshire Council and latterly Convener of Education.

politicalExperience.role: Convener of Education in Clackmannanshire Council
politicalExperience.achievements: Contributing positively to the success of schools.

images.caption: Alison Lindsay with Bruce Crawford MSP and Adam Ingram, Executive Minister of Children and Early Years.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasizes that the SNP is the only party that can challenge both Labour and Tories, and puts the needs of Stirling first.
